CLUE: Of abode of the blessed dead in Greek mythology
OUTPUT: ['The meadows were said to be located in the underworld, near the river Styx, and were ruled by the god Hermes.', 'In Homer\'s "Odyssey," the hero Odysseus visits the Asphodel Meadows after his journey to the underworld, and encounters the shades of those who had lived a mundane life without any great achievements or failures.', 'The souls who resided there were described as being in a state of suspended animation, unable to feel any strong emotions or sensations.']
